<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Tangled Forest Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=6015) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=656" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=701" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 123 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Requirements**
You are unarmored.

</column>

---

You extend your arms like gnarled branches to interfere with your foes' movements. You can make lashing branch unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 slashing damage; are in the [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4) group; and have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=526), [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=602), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661), and [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=719) traits.

 While you're in Tangled Forest Stance and can act, every enemy in your reach that tries to move away from you must succeed at a Reflex save, [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) check, or [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) check against your class DC or be [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=81) for that action. If you prefer, you can allow the enemy to move.

<title level="2">Tangled Forest Stance leads to...</title>
[Tangled Forest Rake](/Feats.aspx?ID=6036)
name: Tangled Forest Stance
